wiki.content: Baby, I Love Your Way is a song written and performed by singer Peter Frampton that was first featured on Frampton's 1975 album, Frampton. A live version (4:37) of the song was later released on his 1976 multi-platinum album Frampton Comes Alive!, where it gained popularity as a hit song, peaking at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The most popular cover version of this song by Big Mountain from 1994 is often mistakenly credited to Bob Marley and also to UB40 due to mislabeled MP3 files which circulated through P2P networks, similar to the artist confusion of the song Cat's in the Cradle. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: Baby, I Love Your Way is a song written and performed by singer Peter Frampton that was first featured on Frampton's 1975 album, Frampton. A live version (4:37) of the song was later released on his 1976 multi-platinum album Frampton Comes Alive!, where it gained popularity as a hit song, peaking at #12 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The most popular cover version of this song by Big Mountain from 1994 is often mistakenly credited to Bob Marley and also to UB40 due to mislabeled MP3 files which circulated through P2P networks, similar to the artist confusion of the song Cat's in the Cradle.

track.name: Baby I Love Your Way
comments: Another one of those reggae songs that I fell in love with!

its very relaxing! I got peace in ma soul)
